content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-347-07-A
|Item_parent=Acute urine retention
|Item_parent_short=Acute urine retention
|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the initial assessment of urinary retention
|Description=None
|Rubric=Additional tests
|Contributors=Jonathan Olivier
|Order=7}}

* No further tests are required as a matter of urgency.
* If there is any doubt about the diagnosis, a suprapubic ultrasound may be performed to assess bladder fullness.

question.question: Which of the following is the most appropriate initial assessment for suspected acute urinary retention?
question.option_a: Performing a blood test to check kidney function
question.option_b: Ordering a CT scan to visualize the urinary tract
question.option_c: Conducting a suprapubic ultrasound if there is any doubt about the diagnosis
question.option_d: Immediately administering diuretics to promote urine flow
